intro: Fimbristylis andongensis, commonly known as the Andong sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to China and is typically found in wetland or marshy habitats. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native environment. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
